Package de.a46.memory.gui

Package de.a46.memory.gui contains all gui functionality.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ButtonbarListener Interface ButtonbarListener defines methods that will be called if a mouseclick happens to a button in the ButtonbarPanel.
MPanelListener This interface defines three methods, that will be called when events occure on a MPanel.
RessourceContainer This interface defines a number of multimedia resources needed to display the memory.
YesNoListener Interface YesNoListener describes a dialog, where the user can answer yes or no.
 

Class Summary
ButtonbarPanel Class ButtonbarPanel represents the button bar of the memory gui.
ExitPanel Class ExitPanel represents a confirm-close dialog.
FieldPanel Class FieldPanel belongs to the rightPanel family.
HelpPanel Class HelpPanel has the specific size of 480 x 480 pixel and shows a help text.
HiddencardPanel Class HiddenCardPanel represents one card in the field.
LeftPanel Class LeftPanel is the left part of the memory screen.
MainPanel Class MainPanel is the main gui class. its father-component is the applet-extending Starter, child components are a ButtonbarPanel, a LeftPanel and a RightPanel. its size is fixed 720 x 502 pixel.

this is also an active component, because it performs reaction to buttonbar clicked events and to ActionEvents from the HelpPanel and the ExitPanel.
MButton Class MButton represents a button that is drawing different images corresponding to its state.
MPanel this class reacts like a button.
MultiImagePanel This grafical class allows to show an unlimited number of images.
RightPanel Class RightPanel is an abstract superclass for all panels been shown as right components in the mainPanel.
 

Package de.a46.memory.gui Description

Package de.a46.memory.gui contains all gui functionality. The components are structured as a tree, where class MainPanel is the root component, representing the whole plane of 720 x 502 pixel. There are three child components implemented by class ButtonbarPanel, by class LeftPanel and by abstract class RightPanel. In correspondence to user action a concrete instance of class FieldPanel, class HelpPanel or class ExitPanel is shown, all subclassing RightPanel. All resources the gui needs are defined in interface RessourceContainer.

Also a few basic components are defined. Abstract class MPanel defines a component that casts events when the mouse enters, clicks or exits. Its subclass MButton acts like a common java.awt.Button, but displayes images representing eg. the pressed-state or the disabled-state. MPanel is also subclassed by MultiImagePanel, that displays one image from an array.

See the class diagram for this package.
